titleStmt.title: Gods revenge against murther containing the confessions, prayers, discourses, and last dying sayings of Mr. Edward Harrison, who was try'd, convicted, and deservedly sentenced the sixth and ninth of this instant April, 1692. for the late unheard of murther of Dr. Clench; and accordingly executed in Holborn, on Friday the fifteenth following. Licensed according to order.
titleStmt.author: Harrison, Henry, d. 1692.

titleStmt.title: Gods revenge against murther containing the confessions, prayers, discourses, and last dying sayings of Mr. Edward Harrison, who was try'd, convicted, and deservedly sentenced the sixth and ninth of this instant April, 1692. for the late unheard of murther of Dr. Clench; and accordingly executed in Holborn, on Friday the fifteenth following. Licensed according to order.
titleStmt.author: Harrison, Henry, d. 1692.

notesStmt.note: Wing H892 and others give name of the accused as Henry Harrison.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
